turns.content: The story of the 1520 Stockholm Bloodbath, as told by a sarcastic valley girl.

Oh my god, like, have you heard about the Stockholm Bloodbath? Like, it was soooooo intense.

Okay, so here's what happened: there was this dude named Christian II, and he was like the king of Denmark and Sweden and stuff. But apparently, he was kind of a jerk, because he decided to invite all these noblemen to a fancy banquet in Stockholm. But little did they know, he was planning on murdering them all.

I mean, seriously, how twisted is that? Like, who invites people to a fancy dinner and then murders them? That's just, like, the ultimate party foul.

So, Christian II's men went around and started hacking these noblemen to death with swords. It was so gruesome, and there was blood everywhere. They even killed a bunch of people in a church, which is just, like, not cool at all.

I don't even know how many people died, but it was a lot. Like, a LOT. It was basically a massacre.

Anyway, the whole thing was called the Stockholm Bloodbath, and it was just super messed up. Like, I can't even imagine being invited to a fancy dinner and then getting murdered. That's like, the worst possible way to die.

But, you know, at least Christian II got what he deserved. He was later overthrown and exiled, so I guess karma came back to bite him in the butt.

So, like, moral of the story: don't trust anyone who invites you to a fancy dinner, because they might just be planning on killing you. #dinnerpartiesareoverrated
